summary: This bill, the Peer to Peer Mental Health Support Act, authorizes the Assistant Secretary for Mental Health and Substance Use to carry out a pilot program providing grants to eligible entities (states, political subdivisions, etc.) to support evidence-based peer support activities for secondary school students. The program aims to improve mental health outcomes by providing training, early identification of mental health challenges, and support for recovery.  The bill also mandates an evaluation of the program and requires a report to Congress. The program will sunset on September 30, 2029.
